title: Ethereum (ETH) Price Analysis for April 15 - U.Today
summary: Ethereum (ETH) is trading sideways at the beginning of the weekend, with little change in price since yesterday. On the local chart, ETH is closer to resistance than support, indicating that bulls are stronger than bears. A daily closing above $2,100 could lead to a breakout and rise to $2,130. On the bigger time frame, ETH is consolidating in a narrow range of $2,075-$2,130. If the rate closes above $2,015 on the weekly chart, there could be a further rise to $2,200-$2,300. As of press time, ETH is trading at $2,099.

title: Crypto Trader Says Ethereum Altcoin That’s Exploded 190% This Year Is About To Hit New All-Time High - The Daily Hodl
summary: Crypto trader Smart Contracter predicts that the Ethereum-based altcoin Optimism (OP) will reach new all-time highs after surging 190% this year. He also believes that Litecoin (LTC) is flashing a bullish signal against Bitcoin (BTC) and is a good accumulation opportunity. Meanwhile, Smart Contracter thinks the fear surrounding the Shanghai update for Ethereum (ETH) is overblown and is reminiscent of Bitcoin's price action in 2019. ETH is trading at $2,095, down 1.5% in the last 24 hours.

title: Bitcoin, Ethereum and XRP Price Analysis for April 15, 2023 - CryptoTicker.io - Bitcoin Price, Ethereum Price & Crypto News
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Bitcoin, Ethereum, and XRP prices are analyzed for April 15, 2023. Bitcoin prices rose from $19,700 to $31,000, with a short-term resistance at $31,000. Ethereum's chart resembles Bitcoin's, with a high price of $2,115 and a potential retraction to $1,950. XRP prices consolidated at $0.36 and then rose by 60% to $0.50, with a potential target of $0.60.

title: ENS asks court to transfer eth.link after DNS abuse complaint takes site down - Domain Name Wire
summary: ENS seeks court transfer of eth.link domain after DNS abuse took site down. Court previously issued preliminary injunction in favor of ENS, but Dynadot placed transfer lock on domain. ENS now wants to transfer domain to new registrar to prevent potential disruptions.

title: Canon's Cadabra Joins NFT Craze with Ethereum Photo Marketplace - Crypto Times
summary: Canon is launching an NFT marketplace called Cadabra for photography, following a successful NFT drop in 2022. The platform will offer tokenized photographs, including tangible prints, and a secondary resale market. Participating artists can earn new sources of income, and the marketplace will accept payments in cryptocurrencies. The marketplace will compete with other photographic NFT marketplaces and feature prominent artists such as Isaac "Drift" Wright and Justin Aversano. The platform aims to provide collectors with rare and valuable digital artworks and new revenue streams for artists.

title: BlockSec launches collaborative testing toolkit for private forked chains - Cointelegraph
summary: BlockSec has launched a new toolkit called Phalcon Fork, which enables collaborative testing on private chains "forked from arbitrary (transaction) positions" and block numbers on the Ethereum mainnet. The toolkit provides greater control over work being conducted on testnets, including the ability to easily fork mainnet positions and retain certain services and states. It also includes features such as snapshots, an integrated faucet for acquiring free fork network Ether, and a remote procedure call node called Fork RPC for interacting with the chains. Future support for additional blockchains is also teased.

title: #CryptoExplained: The Wonderful World of Ethereum - Rolling Stone India
summary: Ethereum is a decentralized system like Bitcoin, but with additional features like smart contracts, which are immutable and trustless. These contracts can be used to create decentralized applications (dApps) like tokens, non-fungible tokens (NFTs), decentralized exchanges, and more. The Ethereum ecosystem is more valuable than the Bitcoin ecosystem because it has more financial assets, and the vast majority of crypto currencies are actually ERC-20 tokens that run on Ethereum. Smart contracts form the basis of innovations in crypto, such as Crypto Kitties, Nouns DAO, Uniswap, and Crypto Punks, which are turning finance, law, and value transfer on its head. The wonderful world of Ethereum is poised to continue creating new innovations and changing the way we think about trust and value transfer.

title: With Bitcoin (BTC) and Ethereum (ETH) Rallying How Does Their Growth Compare To New Deflationary Meme Coin ... - Analytics Insight
summary: DigiToads, a new meme coin, is gaining popularity due to its deflationary and utility-rich features. Compared to major crypto projects like Bitcoin and Ethereum, DigiToads has shown high growth potential. The token allows holders to earn residual income through NFT staking and P2E gaming, and it has already raised over $1.2m in its presale. DigiToads also plans to support the Amazon rainforest by donating 2.5% of its funds to charities dedicated to replanting trees and preserving the rainforest. Bitcoin and Ethereum, on the other hand, are well-established crypto projects with limited supply and exciting features like decentralized applications and smart contracts. However, their supply is infinite, which could lead to deflationary pressure. Overall, DigiToads offers a unique opportunity for investors to earn passive income through holding and staking its tokens, making it an attractive investment opportunity.

title: Testnets in Crypto: How To Use Test Networks to Earn Cryptocurrency - DailyCoin
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Testnets are valueless, low-risk environments for testing blockchain applications and smart contracts.

Purpose: To trail contracts and applications in a free environment to expose vulnerabilities and security issues.

Benefits: Testnets provide a secure environment for developers to make mistakes and break things safely before the public uses them. Developers still need testnet coins to pay transaction fees, which have some demand from developers testing decentralized applications.

Why use a testnet? Even if you're not a blockchain developer, there are benefits to using a testnet, such as accessing emerging crypto projects and earning token airdrops.

How to access a testnet: Use a trusted site like Chainlist to connect your wallet and configure your testnet account.

Which blockchain networks have a testnet? Almost every blockchain in the cryptocurrency industry uses a testnet of some description.

Scams: Be cautious of scammers who may try to confuse you into sending your real crypto for valueless
